definition: to bring out the main theme/to make the point/to bring out the substance concisely

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: In the meantime, it points out the problems that need further study.
sentences.chinese: 同時，對需要進一步研究的問題也予點題。

sentences.english: Official vehicle-using system reform has become a hot issue that arouses great concern in today's society.
sentences.chinese: 公務用車改造已成爲人們普遍關注的暖點題目。

sentences.english: My favorite sport is Taekwondo. I started to learn it four years ago.
sentences.chinese: 小作者開篇點題，說出了自己最喜歡的運動是跆拳道。

sentences.english: Steel and modern furniture configuration let whole style of strong point.
sentences.chinese: 鋼材和現代感極強的傢俱配置讓整體風格點題。

sentences.english: They think, do more good point.

definition: (of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
